title: JavaBoolean Data Types

metadata.description: Learn about JavaBoolean Data Types with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Boolean Types
Very often in programming, you will need a data type that can only have one of two values, like:
YES / NO
ON / OFF
TRUE / FALSE
For this, Java has a
boolean
data type, which can only take the values
true
or
false
:
Example
boolean isJavaFun = true;
boolean isFishTasty = false;
System.out.println(isJavaFun);     // Outputs true
System.out.println(isFishTasty);   // Outputs false

Boolean values are mostly used for conditional testing.
You will learn much more about
booleans
and
conditions
later in this tutorial.

★
+1

What is Outputs false

quiz.explanation:

Boolean values is 'mostly used for conditional testing'.

quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers JavaBoolean Data Types concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use JavaBoolean Data Types effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of JavaBoolean Data Types and how to apply it in your projects.
